questions.question: For line parallel to VP and perpendicular to HP

explanations.a: Correct, the right answer is (a). If a line is parallel to VP and perpendicular to HP, then the line will intersect with HP, therefore creating Horizontal Trace(HT).
explanations.b: The right answer is (a). If a line is parallel to HP and perpendicular to VP, then the line will intersect with VP, therefore creating Vertical Trace(VT).
explanations.c: The right answer is (a). A line can have both a horizontal trace and a vertical trace at the same time. This happens when the line is inclined to both the horizontal plane (HP) and the vertical plane (VP).
explanations.d: The right answer is (a). For line parallel to VP and perpendicular to HP, HT will exist.

questions.question: A line inclined to VP and parallel to HP will have its Front view

explanations.a: Correct, the right answer is (a). If the line is inclined at VP and parallel to or situated at HP, then its front view will be the line of length less than the given line.
explanations.b: The right answer is (a). If the line is inclined at HP and parallel to or situated at VP, then its front view will be the line of length larger than the given line.
explanations.c: The right answer is (a). When a line is perpendicular to one plane and parallel to another plane, The projection of the line on the plane to which it is parallel will show its true length. Therefore, the front view will be the line of the same length.
explanations.d: The right answer is (a). If the line is inclined at VP and parallel to or situated at HP, then its front view will be the line of length less than the given line.

questions.question: If a line RS lies on both vertical and horizontal planes then which of the following two views coincides to give a line again?

explanations.a: Correct, the right answer is (a).  Isometric view is that the three dimensions of a solid are not only shown in one view. Here given the line is present in vertical and horizontal plane so the line will coincide in the front view and top view.
